snippet: Mr. Whelan, who had a long career in journalism, was the founding editor and publisher of the newspaper. He resigned after two years, saying it was a “Moonie newspaper.”
abstract: James R Whelan, founding editor and publisher of The Washington Times, dies at age 79.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Whelan, who had a long career in journalism, was the founding editor and publisher of the newspaper. He resigned after two years, saying it was a “Moonie newspaper.”

headline.seo: James R. Whelan, First Editor of The Washington Times, Dies at 79
headline.main: James R. Whelan, First Editor of The Washington Times, Dies at 79
headline.print_headline: James R. Whelan, 79, Editor; Led The Washington Times
